info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun, southeastern Macon and northwestern Oconee Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Clayton, or 6 miles southeast of Sky Valley, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Mountain City, Sky Valley, Highlands, Mountain Rest, Scaly Mountain and Pine Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
